data.value: implements a method for robust linear regression using repeated medians (see ) to fit a line to the points (x, y). The method is robust to outliers with an asymptotic breakdown point of 50%.

lines through the remaining points and take the median
times the median of a vector of size
which can be slow for large vectors. There are more efficient algorithms (see ) which are not implemented here.
For compatibility with older versions of SciPy, the return value acts like a
, so one can continue to write:
If 'hierarchical', estimate the intercept using the estimated slope
(default option). If 'separate', estimate the intercept independent of the estimated slope. See Notes for details.
